results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Actors’ school - the new Paris Conservatory classes. 2. results.title: France panorama. [No. 67/18]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The Cannes Festival - opening of the Cannes Film Festival showing glimpses of celebrities including Gina Lollobrigida, Annie Girardot, Yves Montand, Geraldine Chaplin, Claude Lelouch. 2. Art in the raw and therapy art: An exhibition at the Musee des Art Decoraties of “L’Art Brut”. St Anne’s Hospital for the mentally ill has introduced art sessions for its patients. 3. Chantiers Sous-Marins - focuses on the training of professional skin-divers. 4. A stroll in the past - presents one of Paris’ 60 villages. 5. France’s most spectacular historical gardens.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 66/50]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: Christmas in Paris - Highlights the various French customs involved with celebrating Christmas including the consuming of shellfish, decorating the city streets and shop fronts, and attending Church. Also includes images of the homeless in Paris being given special packages for this festive date.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 65?/38]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Le Paquebot des sables - Shows a dredge in South France preparing for the beaching of the liner ‘Lydia’. 2. Le Monde de Miro - shows paintings on cardboard by artist Joan Miro. 3. Sports nautiques - coverage of French water-skiers. 4. Vu pour voux - a look at Americans in Gourin in Britanny, north-west France. 5. Two views of Paris in August - 6.00am and 9.00am and special luxury cattery in Parisian suburb.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 65/23]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. L’Europe on marche - economic summit between English Prime Minister, Edward Heath, and the French President. 2. Technique - new waterways and converting earth and rock into liquid gases. 3. Bibliotheque pilote - a new state of the art library . 4. Un Prix Nobel a Pasteur - a Nobel prize winner at the Pasteur Institute of Science. 5. Les ailes et la musique - wings and music.

results.title: Material unaccounted for
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
Investigates the security of the nuclear plant at which Karen Silkwood worked before her mysterious death. Radioactive material had been placed in Ms. Silkwood’s home during the period in which she was campaigning against the working conditions and safety measures at the U.S. American plant.
